jparsec.ephem.planets

Class JPLEphemeris

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.ephem.planets.JPLEphemeris

  • public class JPLEphemeris
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to perform ephemeris calculations using JPL numerical integration theories. Available integrations are DE200, DE403, DE405, DE406, DE413, DE414, DE422, and DE430. The necessary files in ASCII format are provided to cover the time span from 1950 to 2050, or greater in some cases.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

      • MOON_SECULAR_ACCELERATION_DE403

        public static final double MOON_SECULAR_ACCELERATION_DE403
        Value of the Moon secular acceleration ("/cy^2) for DE403 and DE404. The value is -25.8 as it appears in the IOM of JPL for DE403, but from the information of the IOM of JPL DE421 it seems that this value could be -26.06. See page 7 of http://naif.jpl.nasa.gov/pub/naif/generic_kernels/spk/planets/de421_lunar_ephemeris_and_orientation.pdf.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MOON_SECULAR_ACCELERATION_DE405

        public static final double MOON_SECULAR_ACCELERATION_DE405
        Value of the Moon secular acceleration ("/cy^2) for DE405 and DE406.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MOON_SECULAR_ACCELERATION_DE200

        public static final double MOON_SECULAR_ACCELERATION_DE200
        Value of the Moon secular acceleration ("/cy^2) for DE200.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MOON_SECULAR_ACCELERATION_DE413

        public static final double MOON_SECULAR_ACCELERATION_DE413
        Value of the Moon secular acceleration ("/cy^2) for DE413 and DE414. It requires confirmation.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MOON_SECULAR_ACCELERATION_DE422

        public static final double MOON_SECULAR_ACCELERATION_DE422
        Value of the Moon secular acceleration ("/cy^2) for DE422. It requires confirmation. The value is for DE421 according to http://naif.jpl.nasa.gov/pub/naif/generic_kernels/spk/planets/de421_lunar_ephemeris_and_orientation.pdf.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MOON_SECULAR_ACCELERATION_DE430

        public static final double MOON_SECULAR_ACCELERATION_DE430
        Value of the Moon secular acceleration ("/cy^2) for DE430. From http://ipnpr.jpl.nasa.gov/progress_report/42-196/196C.pdf.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • JPLEphemeris

        public JPLEphemeris()
             throws JPARSECException
        Default constructor for DE405 JPL ephemerides,
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the integration version is not available (the header could not be read).

      • JPLEphemeris

        public JPLEphemeris(EphemerisElement.ALGORITHM jplID)
             throws JPARSECException
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        jplID - ID for the JPL ephemeris version.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the integration version is not available (the header could not be read).

      • JPLEphemeris

        public JPLEphemeris(EphemerisElement.ALGORITHM jplID,
            java.lang.String externalPath)
             throws JPARSECException
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        jplID - ID for the JPL ephemeris version.
        externalPath - External path for the external directory of the JPL files to read. They must be ASCII files named like ascpYEAR.xxx, where YEAR is the starting year of validity and xxx is the JPL ephemeris version. Only JPL DE405 (years 1600 to 2200), DE406/422/424 (3000 B.C. to 3100), and DE430 (1550 to 2650) are supported when reading external files. Files can be downloaded from ftp://ssd.jpl.nasa.gov/pub/eph/planets/ascii/. Set to null to use JPARSEC file if it is available.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the integration version is not available (the header could not be read).

    • Method Detail

      • getJPLVersion

        public int getJPLVersion()
        Returns JPL ephemeris version of this instance. The returned value is not equal to jplID. For example, this method returns 200 for DE200.
        Returns:
        JPL version.

      • getJPLVersionID

        public EphemerisElement.ALGORITHM getJPLVersionID()
        Returns JPL ephemeris id version of this instance. The returned value is equal to jplID. For example, this method returns 0 for the last supported version, DE430.
        Returns:
        JPL version id.

      • isAvailable

        public boolean isAvailable(double jd)
        Returns if the ephemerides file is available or not.
        Parameters:
        jd - Julian day of the calculations, file name depends on this.
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • getJPLEphemeris

        public EphemElement getJPLEphemeris(TimeElement time,
                           ObserverElement obs,
                           EphemerisElement eph)
                             throws JPARSECException
        Calculate ephemeris, providing full data. This method uses JPL ephemeris. The position of the Moon will contains the librations computed using JPL ephemerides in case the integration is one of the supported in LunarEvent.getJPLMoonLibrations(TimeElement, ObserverElement, EphemerisElement, LocationElement), otherwise Eckhardt's theory will be used. In case of lunar ephemerides you may also want to correct it from center of mass to geometric center by means of Elp2000.fromMoonBarycenterToGeometricCenter(TimeElement, ObserverElement, EphemerisElement, EphemElement).
        Parameters:
        time - Time object containing the date.
        obs - Observer object containing the observer position.
        eph - Ephemeris object with the target and ephemeris properties.
        Returns:
        Ephem object containing ephemeris data. Rise, set, transit times and maximum elevation fields are not computed in this method, use Ephem class for that.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the calculation fails.

      • getGeocentricPosition

        public double[] getGeocentricPosition(double JD,
                             Target.TARGET planet,
                             double light_time,
                             boolean addSat,
                             ObserverElement obs)
                               throws JPARSECException
        Get rectangular equatorial geocentric position of a planet in epoch J2000.
        Parameters:
        JD - Julian day in TDB.
        planet - Target ID.
        light_time - Light time in days.
        addSat - True to add the planetocentric position of the satellite to the position of the planet.
        obs - The observer object. Can be null for the Earth's center.
        Returns:
        Array with x, y, z, (geocentric position) vx, vy, vz (earth barycentric velocity) coordinates. Note velocity components are those for the Earth (used for aberration correction) not those for the planet relative to the geocenter.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the calculation fails.

      • getGeocentricPosition

        public double[] getGeocentricPosition(java.math.BigDecimal JD,
                             Target.TARGET planet,
                             double light_time,
                             boolean addSat,
                             ObserverElement obs)
                               throws JPARSECException
        Get rectangular equatorial geocentric position of a planet in epoch J2000, using extended precision. Not actively used in JPARSEC.
        Parameters:
        JD - Julian day in TDB.
        planet - Target ID.
        light_time - Light time in days.
        addSat - True to add the planetocentric position of the satellite to the position of the planet.
        obs - The observer object. Can be null for the Earth's center.
        Returns:
        Array with x, y, z, (geocentric position) vx, vy, vz (earth barycentric velocity) coordinates. Note velocity components are those for the Earth (used for aberration correction) not those for the planet relative to the geocenter.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the calculation fails.

      • getPositionAndVelocity

        public double[] getPositionAndVelocity(double jd,
                              Target.TARGET target)
                                throws JPARSECException
        Obtains position and velocity of certain object using the selected JPL ephemeris version.
        Parameters:
        jd - Julian day, TDB.
        target - Target. Can be a planet, Pluto, or the Sun, Moon, Earth-Moon barycenter, or can be also nutation and libration.
        Returns:
        A vector with equatorial position and velocity from Solar System Barycenter, refered to ICRS (or dynamical equinox and equator for DE200) and J2000 equinox. For the Moon the geocentric position is returned.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getPositionAndVelocity

        public double[] getPositionAndVelocity(java.math.BigDecimal bigjd,
                              Target.TARGET target)
                                throws JPARSECException
        Obtains position and velocity of certain object using the selected JPL ephemeris version, and an input date with arbitrary precision. The use of high precision double values is generally innecesary and not actively used in JPARSEC.
        Parameters:
        bigjd - Julian day, TDB.
        target - Target. Can be a planet, Pluto, or the Sun, Moon, Earth-Moon barycenter, or can be also nutation and libration.
        Returns:
        A vector with equatorial position and velocity from Solar System Barycenter, refered to ICRS (or dynamical equinox and equator for DE200) and J2000 equinox.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • timeCorrectionForSecularAcceleration

        public static double timeCorrectionForSecularAcceleration(double jd,
                                          EphemerisElement.ALGORITHM jplID)
        Corrects Julian day of calculations of JPL Ephemeris for a different value of the secular acceleration of the Moon. This method uses the current value of static variable Elp2000.MOON_SECULAR_ACCELERATION, which is the (usually) adopted value. This correction is not applied automatically in JPARSEC, and should only be applied to lunar ephemerides (mainly for DE200).
        Parameters:
        jd - Julian day in dynamical time.
        jplID - The algorithm.
        Returns:
        Correction to non-dynamical time in days.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
